result.execSummary:
The defendant Carmen D Coste-Caraballo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Attend an Anger Management course.
Attend Domestic Abuse Counseling.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Carmen D Coste-Caraballo in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and state moves to strike the repeater allegation. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

1 year jail, (CREDIT - 3 days);

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment   
*No contact with:  the victims or their employment or residence
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done within 3 business days
*Attend a Anger Management Course
*Attend Domestic Counseling
*Not to use/possess any dangerous weapons, firearms/knives

 COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 45, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

APPLY ANY BAIL THAT IS POSTED AND REFUND BALANCE TO THE POSTER
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-22-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Carmen D Coste-Caraballo in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Defense counsel is requesting a plea date. Court grants.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carmen D Coste-Caraballo in court with attorney Thomas Flannigan.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment at 09-21-2015 10:00 am
#1 - from preliminary hearing held on 8/28/15 - scanned

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.

Defendant Carmen D Coste-Caraballo in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawna Stevenoski, Interpreter, also appears.  Case called for preliminary hearing, proceeds to hearing.  Officer Angela Mesich, City of Muskego, sworn & testified. Cross examined by Attorney Flanagan.  Redirect by the State.  Exhibit #1 - Statement of Mr. Hogan.   State rests.  No testimony by defense.  Testimony closed.  State moves for bind over.  Defense objects to bind over and move for dismissal.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.    Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 7/21/2015 at 10:00 a.m.
